intro: Pimpinella crispulifolia, commonly known as the crinkled cow-wheat, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving them a crinkled appearance. The species is native to parts of Europe and Asia, and it is often found in temperate regions with cool, humid climates.
